results.title: Sign Up for the Science Times Newsletter
results.abstract: Every week, we’ll bring you stories that capture the wonders of the human body, nature and the cosmos.

results.title: The U.S. Has Billions for Wind and Solar Projects. Good Luck Plugging Them In.
results.abstract: An explosion in proposed clean energy ventures has overwhelmed the system for connecting new power sources to homes and businesses.

multimedia.caption: Pouring concrete for a wind turbine in Nebraska. More than 8,100 energy projects were waiting for permission to connect to electric grids at the end of 2021.
multimedia.copyright: Walker Pickering for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Pouring concrete for a wind turbine in Nebraska. More than 8,100 energy projects were waiting for permission to connect to electric grids at the end of 2021.

results.title: What’s Inside the Earth’s Core?
results.abstract: Seismic waves measuring earthquakes reveal more about the deepest layers of the planet, a new study suggests.

multimedia.caption: Two Australian scientists argue in a new paper that within the Earth’s core, based on measurements of waves reverberating along the Earth’s diameter, is an innermost inner core, about 800 miles wide.
multimedia.copyright: Drew Whitehouse, National Computational Infrastructure’s Vizlab, Australian National University

multimedia.caption: Two Australian scientists argue in a new paper that within the Earth’s core, based on measurements of waves reverberating along the Earth’s diameter, is an innermost inner core, about 800 miles wide.
multimedia.copyright: Drew Whitehouse, National Computational Infrastructure’s Vizlab, Australian National University

multimedia.caption: Two Australian scientists argue in a new paper that within the Earth’s core, based on measurements of waves reverberating along the Earth’s diameter, is an innermost inner core, about 800 miles wide.
multimedia.copyright: Drew Whitehouse, National Computational Infrastructure’s Vizlab, Australian National University

results.title: Global Declines in Maternal Mortality Have Stalled
results.abstract: Death rates in the United States have increased in recent years, as they have in Europe, the W.H.O. reported.
geo_facet: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

multimedia.caption: A pregnant woman with Covid on her way to a hospital in Senegal. While the pandemic may have contributed to maternal deaths, experts said that didn’t fully explain trends that predated its onset.
A pregnant woman with Covid on her way to a hospital in Senegal. While the pandemic may have contributed to maternal deaths, experts said that didn’t fully explain trends that predated its onset.
A pregnant woman with Covid on her way to a hospital in Senegal. While the pandemic may have contributed to maternal deaths, experts said that didn’t fully explain trends that predated its onset.

results.title: Trump Visits East Palestine, Seeking to Draw Contrast With Biden
results.abstract: The former president has attacked the administration’s handling of the train derailment, even as his own environmental policies while in office have been criticized.
results.byline: By Jazmine Ulloa, Maggie Haberman and Mark Walker

multimedia.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump visited East Palestine, Ohio, on Wednesday, after days of criticizing President Biden over a train derailment there.
multimedia.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump visited East Palestine, Ohio, on Wednesday, after days of criticizing President Biden over a train derailment there.
multimedia.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.title: Mpox Often Leads to Severe Illness, Even Death, in People With Advanced H.I.V.
results.abstract: The death rate among these patients is about 15 percent, researchers reported. The virus should be added to the list of opportunistic infections seen in patients with advanced H.I.V., scientists said.

multimedia.caption: A colorized transmission electron micrograph of mpox particles, in red, in an infected cell. Although the number of cases has slowed in most regions, mpox has so far affected roughly 86,000 people in 110 countries and killed 92.
multimedia.copyright: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, via Associated Press

multimedia.caption: A colorized transmission electron micrograph of mpox particles, in red, in an infected cell. Although the number of cases has slowed in most regions, mpox has so far affected roughly 86,000 people in 110 countries and killed 92.
multimedia.copyright: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, via Associated Press

results.title: Parched California Misses a Chance to Store More Rain Underground
results.abstract: Torrential rains could have helped to replenish depleted aquifers, but some say state bureaucracy, designed to distribute water fairly, has stood in the way.
org_facet: California State Water Resources Control Board

multimedia.caption: The overflowing Russian River in mid-January. Next time there’s a storm, a group of vineyards and local agencies hopes to capture more floodwater.
The overflowing Russian River in mid-January. Next time there’s a storm, a group of vineyards and local agencies hopes to capture more floodwater.
The overflowing Russian River in mid-January. Next time there’s a storm, a group of vineyards and local agencies hopes to capture more floodwater.

results.title: A Sudden Rush to Make Sustainable Aviation Fuel Mainstream
results.abstract: United Airlines and other companies have started a $100 million fund to invest in jet fuel that produces fewer greenhouse gases.

multimedia.caption: Aircraft at San Francisco International Airport in 2021. Making sustainable aviation fuel mainstream will be difficult and costly to achieve.
Aircraft at San Francisco International Airport in 2021. Making sustainable aviation fuel mainstream will be difficult and costly to achieve.
Aircraft at San Francisco International Airport in 2021. Making sustainable aviation fuel mainstream will be difficult and costly to achieve.

results.title: Big Soda’s Alcohol Drinks Worry Health Experts
results.abstract: PepsiCo and Coca-Cola enter hard soda markets, causing concerns among regulators and researchers.
org_facet: Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.copyright: Photo illustration by Mike Belleme for The New York Times
Photo illustration by Mike Belleme for The New York Times

results.title: Helping Stroke Patients Regain Movement in Their Hands
results.abstract: The results of an innovative study suggest electrical stimulation of the spinal cord could eventually help some of the many people disabled by strokes.

multimedia.copyright: Kristian Thacker for The New York Times
Kristian Thacker for The New York Times
Kristian Thacker for The New York Times

results.title: A Fraught New Frontier in Telehealth: Ketamine
results.abstract: With loosened rules around remote prescriptions, a psychedelic-like drug has become a popular treatment for mental health conditions. But a boom in at-home use has outpaced evidence of safety.

results.title: In a First, a Woman Issues a Thunderstorm Watch, Officials Say
results.abstract: The National Weather Service has issued thunderstorm and tornado watches for decades, but one had never been sent by a woman, until Wednesday.

multimedia.caption: Elizabeth Leitman at the Storm Prediction Center in Norman, Okla. On Wednesday, she became the first female forecaster to issue a thunderstorm watch in the center’s history, officials said.
multimedia.copyright: Nick Oxford for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Elizabeth Leitman at the Storm Prediction Center in Norman, Okla. On Wednesday, she became the first female forecaster to issue a thunderstorm watch in the center’s history, officials said.
multimedia.copyright: Nick Oxford for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Elizabeth Leitman at the Storm Prediction Center in Norman, Okla. On Wednesday, she became the first female forecaster to issue a thunderstorm watch in the center’s history, officials said.
multimedia.copyright: Nick Oxford for The New York Times

results.title: How Climate Change Is Making Tampons (and Lots of Other Stuff) More Expensive
results.abstract: Cotton farmers in Texas suffered record losses amid heat and drought last year, new data shows. It’s an example of how global warming is a “secret driver of inflation.”

multimedia.caption: A few cotton bolls leftover after the harvest in Meadow, Texas.
multimedia.copyright: Jordan Vonderhaar for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: A few cotton bolls leftover after the harvest in Meadow, Texas.
multimedia.copyright: Jordan Vonderhaar for The New York Times

multimedia.copyright: Jordan Vonderhaar for The New York Times

results.title: With Two Key Picks, Biden Weaves Climate Into Economy and Regulations
results.abstract: The president adds climate champions Lael Brainard as his top economic adviser and Richard Revesz as his regulations chief.
results.byline: By Coral Davenport and Jeanna Smialek

multimedia.caption: Lael Brainard is President Biden’s new director of the National Economic Council. As vice chair of the Federal Reserve, she became known for warning of the risks climate change poses to the financial system.
multimedia.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Lael Brainard is President Biden’s new director of the National Economic Council. As vice chair of the Federal Reserve, she became known for warning of the risks climate change poses to the financial system.
multimedia.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

results.title: Norfolk Southern’s Profits and Accident Rates Rose in Recent Years
results.abstract: Safety experts say a focus on financial returns may be partly to blame for derailments and accidents like the one in Ohio.
results.byline: By Peter Eavis and Mark Walker

multimedia.caption: The accident rate at Norfolk Southern, which operated the train that derailed in East Palestine, Ohio, increased in each of the last four years, a company presentation said.
The accident rate at Norfolk Southern, which operated the train that derailed in East Palestine, Ohio, increased in each of the last four years, a company presentation said.
The accident rate at Norfolk Southern, which operated the train that derailed in East Palestine, Ohio, increased in each of the last four years, a company presentation said.

results.title: Sandra Trehub, Pioneer in the Psychology of Music, Dies at 84
results.abstract: She showed that basic musical ability is present in infants across cultures, laying a foundation for a growing field of study.

multimedia.caption: Sandra Trehub in an undated photo. “Every bit of research in the psychology of music over the past 40 years can be traced back to Sandra Trehub,” a fellow psychologist said.
Sandra Trehub in an undated photo. “Every bit of research in the psychology of music over the past 40 years can be traced back to Sandra Trehub,” a fellow psychologist said.
Sandra Trehub in an undated photo. “Every bit of research in the psychology of music over the past 40 years can be traced back to Sandra Trehub,” a fellow psychologist said.

results.title: Spain Allows Legal Gender Change Without a Medical Evaluation
results.abstract: A new law will allow people 16 and older to change their registered gender without undergoing psychological and medical evaluations to show gender dysphoria.
results.byline: By Emma Bubola and José Bautista

multimedia.caption: L.G.B.T.Q. activists in Madrid on Thursday celebrated the final approval of a law making it easier for people to legally change their gender.
L.G.B.T.Q. activists in Madrid on Thursday celebrated the final approval of a law making it easier for people to legally change their gender.
L.G.B.T.Q. activists in Madrid on Thursday celebrated the final approval of a law making it easier for people to legally change their gender.

results.title: New Auroras Found Glowing in the Skies of Jupiter’s Moons
results.abstract: Researchers reported auroras around Jupiter’s two largest Galilean moons for the first time and found new features in the auroras of volcanic Io and icy Europa.

multimedia.caption: The auroras are visible on the moons during an eclipse, said an author of the studies.
The auroras are visible on the moons during an eclipse, said an author of the studies.
The auroras are visible on the moons during an eclipse, said an author of the studies.

results.title: Higher Bills Are Leading Americans to Delay Medical Care
results.abstract: Inflation and pressing household expenses are forcing some people to postpone health needs, an emerging trend that has health experts worried that conditions may only worsen.

multimedia.caption: Megan Swanson with her daughter Jojo.
multimedia.copyright: Melanie Metz for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Megan Swanson with her daughter Jojo.
multimedia.copyright: Melanie Metz for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Megan Swanson with her daughter Jojo.
multimedia.copyright: Melanie Metz for The New York Times

results.title: Scientists Wondered if Warming Caused Argentina’s Drought. The Answer: No.
results.abstract: Climate change didn’t make the dry spell more likely, researchers found, though extreme heat probably made it hurt more.

multimedia.caption: A cornfield outside Buenos Aires in January. The drought became especially severe in the last three months of 2022.
A cornfield outside Buenos Aires in January. The drought became especially severe in the last three months of 2022.
A cornfield outside Buenos Aires in January. The drought became especially severe in the last three months of 2022.

results.title: Narcan Is Safe to Sell Over the Counter, Advisers to the F.D.A. Conclude
results.abstract: The overdose reversal drug has been administered mostly by emergency responders and outreach workers. If the agency approves a nonprescription version, it could become as easily available as aspirin.

multimedia.caption: If the Food and Drug Administration accepts the panel’s recommendation, as is expected, the lifesaving medication could be widely available this summer in convenience shops, supermarkets and even vending machines.

If the Food and Drug Administration accepts the panel’s recommendation, as is expected, the lifesaving medication could be widely available this summer in convenience shops, supermarkets and even vending machines.

If the Food and Drug Administration accepts the panel’s recommendation, as is expected, the lifesaving medication could be widely available this summer in convenience shops, supermarkets and even vending machines.

results.title: World Bank President, Dogged by Climate Questions, Will Step Down Early
results.abstract: David Malpass, under fire for months by critics who accused him of climate denialism, said he would resign in June, a year before his term ends.

multimedia.caption: David Malpass was nominated in 2019 by President Donald J. Trump.
David Malpass was nominated in 2019 by President Donald J. Trump.
David Malpass was nominated in 2019 by President Donald J. Trump.

results.title: What Toxic Chemicals Were Aboard the Derailed Train in Ohio?
results.abstract: The train was carrying industrial materials used in plastics, paint thinners and other products, according to information provided to the federal government.
org_facet: Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry

multimedia.caption: Workers prepare to enter the area where the disaster took place.
multimedia.copyright: Ohio National Guard, via Associated Press

multimedia.caption: Workers prepare to enter the area where the disaster took place.
multimedia.copyright: Ohio National Guard, via Associated Press

multimedia.caption: Workers prepare to enter the area where the disaster took place.
multimedia.copyright: Ohio National Guard, via Associated Press

results.title: Scientists Get a Close-Up Look Beneath a Troubling Ice Shelf in Antarctica
results.abstract: A robot lowered through the ice reveals how the Thwaites shelf is melting, which will help forecast its effect on global sea level.

results.title: A Manifesto for Loving the Darkness, and Not Metaphorically
results.abstract: Light pollution is disruptive to many species, from corals to bats to the humans who put up all those lights. “The Darkness Manifesto” urges us to reconsider our drive to dispel the dark.
des_facet: The Darkness Manifesto: On Light Pollution, Night Ecology, and the Ancient Rhythms that Sustain Life (Book)

multimedia.caption: Losing a connection to the night sky is losing our connection to nature, said Johan Eklöf, but it is also losing some of our history. “What we see now is the same sky as our ancestors were looking at and making up stories about.”
multimedia.copyright: Nora Lorek for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Losing a connection to the night sky is losing our connection to nature, said Johan Eklöf, but it is also losing some of our history. “What we see now is the same sky as our ancestors were looking at and making up stories about.”
multimedia.copyright: Nora Lorek for The New York Times

results.title: A Link Between Hearing Voices and Hearing Your Own Voice
results.abstract: An experiment with bone-conduction headphones suggests a way for neuroscientists to better understand some hallucinations.

multimedia.caption: People using bone-conduction headphones in a study were more likely to correctly identify their own voices from a recording in which they were blended with other voices.
People using bone-conduction headphones in a study were more likely to correctly identify their own voices from a recording in which they were blended with other voices.
